title.narrative: 2.2 COVERAGE AND QUALITY OF WATER SERVICES

description.narrative: 2.2 Government authorities at all levels have strengthened capacities to improve the coverage and quality of water services for rural and poor urban households and communities., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children and their families, particularly in rural and poor urban areas, have access to and use affordable and sustainable basic water and sanitation services, and practices safe hygiene behaviors

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.2 Government authorities at all levels have strengthened capacities to improve the coverage and quality of water services for rural and poor urban households and communities.
Number of schools with water and sanitation facilities separated for girls and boys that meet national standards and are have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
Existence of functioning sector coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene
Number of people accessing a sustainable drinking water service in the reporting year only
Number of health care facilities (clinics, health centers, hospitals, etc.) with basic WASH services in the reporting year only, as a result of through institutional uptake (leveraged)
Proportion of people accessing basic drinking water during the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Number of people reached with critical WASH supplies (including hygiene items) and services with UNICEF support [COVIDSitRep]
Number of health centres (clinics, hospitals, etc.) equipped with WASH facilities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support [COVID] ii) Basic sanitation services

Number of health centres (clinics, hospitals, etc.) equipped with WASH facilities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support [COVID] iii) Basic hygiene services (not just supplies, but also hygiene infrastructure)
